text: Henk Faanhof (29 August 1922 â€“ 27 January 2015) was a Dutch professional road bicycle racer from Amsterdam. Faanhof won one stage in the 1954 Tour de France. In 1947, Faanhof was disqualified in the Dutch National Road Race Championship, after changing bicycles with a team mate. He also competed in three events at the 1948 Summer Olympics. Faanhof died in Amsterdam on January 27, 2015, aged 92. ==References== Category:1922 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Dutch cyclists Category:Sportspeople from Amsterdam Category:Tour de France cyclists
title: Henk Faanhof
